meanings.definition: A substance that adsorbs another substance.
meanings.sent1: The adsorbents in the filter trap impurities from the water.
meanings.sent2: Scientists use adsorbents to remove pollutants from the air.
meanings.sent3: The adsorbents at the party were the air fresheners that absorbed all the cooking smells.
meanings.sent4: Her kindness acted as an adsorbent, attracting people towards her.
meanings.sent5: The adsorbents in the sponge soaked up all the spilled juice.

meanings.definition: Materials that are used to adsorb gases or liquids.
meanings.sent1: The company purchased new adsorbents for the gas filtration system.
meanings.sent2: The adsorbents in the lab were running low, so they needed to order more.
meanings.sent3: The adsorbents in the kitchen were the paper towels that quickly absorbed any spills.
meanings.sent4: His words acted as adsorbents, soaking up all the attention in the room.
meanings.sent5: The adsorbents in the soil helped retain moisture for the plants to grow.
